Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the Speaker to file or join amicus briefs on behalf of the Council in litigation challenging the rescission or modification of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program, which provides temporary immigration relief to certain undocumented youth
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
The following 2 Council Members formally noted their opposition to the passage of this resolution:  
Council Members Borelli and Matteo.
The following Council Member formally noted his abstention from voting on this resolution:  
Council Member Gentile.
Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Speaker to file or join amicus briefs on behalf of the Council in litigation challenging the rescission or modification of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Amending the Real Property Law to allow victims of domestic violence to terminate leases upon written notice to landlords.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There is a vacant seat on the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 7, 2017 election for the 28th Council District (Queens).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, October 31, 2017.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk, 
Clerk of the Council
